business.headline: Tata history: From opium wars to boardroom battles, the making of an Indian empireThe history of Tata Group, caught in a boardroom war, is a remarkable tale of ambition, daring ventures, and resilience. This three-part series will explore how a humble family business evolved into India's largest industrial conglomerate, navigating fortunes made from the opium trade and wartime cotton booms, and the enduring challenges that defined its legacy.

Sebi aims to strengthen markets with easier share lending and borrowing: ReportSebi is holding consultations with market participants to improve the Securities Lending and Borrowing (SLB) mechanism, thereby allowing investors to lend or borrow shares for a fee, helping traders take short positions and aiding in better price discovery.

Sensex, Nifty slip as investors book profits; Titan, IT stocks shineThe S&P BSE Sensex fell over 150 points to close below the 82,000 mark, while the Nifty50 slipped more than 60 points to settle just above 25,000. Broader market indices also ended lower, reflecting heightened volatility throughout the day.

Subscribe or skip: Should you ride the ongoing IPO wave on Dalal Street?The IPO rush is exciting, but are investors chasing glitter or real growth? With many listings already below issue price, will patience and selectivity matter more than speed this year?

IndiGo fined Rs 20 lakh by aviation regulator for pilot simulator training lapseThe penalty, imposed on September 26, pertains to the use of non-qualified simulators for training pilots operating at high-risk airports such as Calicut, Leh, and Kathmandu.

Tata Group rift: Which trustees are at the heart of the recent tussle for control?With Home Minister Amit Shah and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stepping in to mediate, all eyes are on the people behind the row. Who are these four trustees challenging Noel Tata's leadership, and how did their differences push one of India's most trusted business families into rare public turbulence?

Are real estate stocks a good bet right now? Experts answerGaurang Shah of Geojit Financial Services, the real estate sector has seen a visible turnaround in the last few years, with developers showing financial discipline and faster project execution. However, he added a word of caution for investors.

How Rs 80K grew to Rs 1.9 lakh savings through simple habits, expert explainsYou don't always need a higher salary to grow your wealth. According to an expert, small, intentional changes in spending and saving helped a client turn his Rs 80,000 salary into Rs 1.9 lakh savings in half a year.

Government urges Tata Group to resolve dispute and restore stability: ReportThe government has urged the Tata Group to restore stability in Tata Trusts following internal disputes that risk affecting Tata Sons, India's largest conglomerate, according to The Economic Times. The conflict involves four trustees within Tata Trusts, who are said to have acted as a "super board," challenging Chairman Noel Tata's authority.

Tata Capital's $1.75 billion IPO fully subscribed after strong institutional backingTata Capital has successfully completed its $1.75 billion IPO, fully subscribed thanks to robust demand from qualified institutional buyers, setting the stage for its stock market debut on October 13.

Another boardroom battle at Tata Group?The current crisis arises from a power tussle within Tata Trusts, the philanthropic arm that holds a controlling stake in Tata Sons, the holding company that runs the operations of the Tata Group.

HDFC Bank cuts lending rates. Will your EMIs drop?HDFC Bank has announced a reduction in its Marginal Cost of Funds-based Lending Rate (MCLR), raising hopes for borrowers. The cut could translate into lower EMIs for many customers.

Gold hits record Rs 1.22 lakh per 10 grams. What should investors do now?Gold prices surged past Rs 1.22 lakh per 10 grams on Wednesday, driven by global uncertainty, a weak dollar, and expectations of US interest rate cuts. Investors are now wondering whether to buy, sell, or stay put.

Nithin Kamath calls for smarter ways to unlock India's $3 trillion gold treasureIndia's homes hold an estimated $3 trillion worth of gold, a treasure that mostly lies untouched. Zerodha's Nithin Kamath believes it's time to put this idle wealth to work through smarter financial ideas.

Titan shares jump over 4% today: What's driving the rally?At around 11:02 am, Titan's stock was trading 4.26% higher at Rs 3,562 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The rally came after the company announced that its domestic jewellery segment grew 19% year-on-year during the July–September quarter.

Trouble in Tata Group? Government asks leadership to restore stability, says reportThe meeting was aimed at maintaining calm within the Tata Trusts, which holds a controlling stake in Tata Sons, the holding company of India's largest conglomerate.

Google to invest $10 billion in Visakhapatnam data hub: ReportThe project will include the construction of three high-capacity submarine cables, dedicated cable landing stations, metro fibre networks, and advanced telecommunications infrastructure.

Sensex, Nifty rally for 5th straight session; Tata Group shares in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex opened firm and was trading 159.69 points higher at 82,086.44 around 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 39.15 points to 25,147.45. Broader market indices also mirrored the positive sentiment, with most trading in the green.

Tata Capital IPO: Will it reward investors like other Tata Group listings?While Tata Capital enjoys strong brand credibility and steady growth, early subscription data and grey market trends indicate a modest response so far for the public listing.

Noel Tata, Chandrasekaran meet Amit Shah amid Tata Trust governance row: ReportNoel Tata was joined by Venu Srinivasan, chairman emeritus of TVS Motor Company, and senior lawyer Darius Khambata for the meeting, which took place at Amit Shah's residence.

entertainment.headline: Sipaara Khan: Arbaaz-Sshura reveal daughter's name. Here's what it means Arbaaz Khan and wife Sshura Khan have named their baby girl Sipaara. Married in December 2023, the couple is embracing parenthood and revealing the meaningful religious significance behind their daughter's name.

Were Hritik Roshan and Jason Mamoa first choice for Baahubali? Producer clarifies As 'Baahubali: The Epic' nears release, producer Shobu Yarlagadda busts long-standing casting rumours around Hrithik Roshan and Jason Momoa.

Who is Krish Pathak, Sara Khan's husband and what's his Ramayan connection? Actor-producer Krish Pathak married popular television actor Sara Khan on Monday. His family's connection to the Ramayan has intrigued fans.

Rowan Atkinson's Netflix comedy Man vs Baby announced, set for December release Rowan Atkinson is back with Netflix's 'Man vs Baby', premiering December 11, 2025, delivering festive laughs as he navigates Christmas chaos while caring for a baby in London.

Tamil film Dude gets big Telugu release, but I don't get same love: Kiran Abbavaram Telugu actor Kiran Abbavaram opened up about the long-standing debate over Telugu films getting a fair release in Tamil Nadu, sharing his disappointment over experiences and the uncertainty of 'K-Ramp' reaching Tamil audiences.

Kalyani Priyadarshan's Lokah enters Rs 300 crore club, a first for Malayalam cinema Kalyani Priyadarshan's 'Lokah: Chapter 1 - Chandra' rewrote Malayalam box office history by becoming the first film to cross the Rs 300 crore mark worldwide.

How Kantara Chapter 1, Avatar celebrate nature's reclamation Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1' depicts the ancient Bhoota Kola ritual, while symbolising nature as the ultimate inheritor, reclaiming all from human ambition. Films like 'Avatar' and 'Bhediya' also highlight the cultural and ecological power of storytelling. IndiaToday.in shares insights on the impact of Man vs Nature themes in cinema.

Nayanthara and Kavin's Tamil rom-com, titled Hi, announced with new posters It's a big 'Hi' from Nayanthara and Kavin! The actors' upcoming romantic drama just got a playful title reveal, accompanied by a charming new poster unveiled on Wednesday, October 8.

Akshay Kumar starts final schedule of Haiwaan, his first negative role Akshay Kumar has started shooting for the final schedule of 'Haiwaan', where he plays a negative role for the first time. He expressed gratitude to his colleagues and shared his experience.

Rajvir Jawanda dies: Ammy Virk, Sonam Bajwa, Punjabi celebs mourn singer's death Punjabi singer Rajvir Jawanda has died at the age of 11 days after a serious motorcycle accident in Himachal Pradesh. He had been hospitalised in critical condition since late September. Friends, celebrities, and fans paid tribute to the late artist as condolences poured in.

Maintenance Required review: Vintage cars, modern mess with too much confusionRelease Date:Wed Oct 08, 2025 Actors Madelaine Petsch and Jacob Scipio's film 'Maintenance Required' is now streaming on Prime Video. However, is the film worth your time? Read our movie review here.

Chandni Bar sequel makers clarify after Madhur Bhandarkar's complaint over title The 'Chandni Bar Returns' makers cleared the air about a complaint filed by filmmaker Madhur Bhandarkar for unauthorised use of his film's title. The makers claimed that they have all the necessary permissions for the title.

Arbaaz Khan, Sshura bring their little one home from hospital. Video Actor Arbaaz Khan and wife Sshura were spotted leaving the hospital with their newborn, marking their first public appearance as parents. In a viral video, a beaming Arbaaz is seen holding the baby in his arms while smiling at the paparazzi.

DK Shivakumar on Bigg Boss Kannada 12 set closure order: Give them a chance Deputy Chief Minister of Karnataka DK Shivakumar said the makers of 'Bigg Boss Kannada' should be given a chance to rectify their mistakes and allowed to re-open the show.

Rishab Shetty on Karur stampede that claimed 41 lives: It's a collective mistake Actor Rishab Shetty reacted to the Karur stampede that left 41 dead. He described the tragedy as a "collective mistake" and commented on crowd control.

Kantara Chapter 1 dethrones original in 6 days, storms box office worldwide Kantara: Chapter 1 has shattered records worldwide, surpassing the original's lifetime collection within six days to earn Rs 427.5 crore globally. The Rishab Shetty-starrer is now the second highest-grossing Kannada film after KGF 2, setting new benchmarks across languages and markets.

From TV to films, Mona Singh continues to captivate audiences with every comeback Mona Singh has mastered the art of supporting roles, consistently leaving a lasting impression with every character she plays. No matter the screen time, she always comes back with performances that the audience remembers and loves.

War 2 on OTT: When and where to watch Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR's action-thriller After an Independence Day release earlier this year, Ayan Mukerji's 'War 2' is set for its release on OTT. The high stakes actioner stars Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR as leads.

People We Meet on Vacation trailer: Tom Blyth, Emily Bader star in Netflix romance Netflix will premiere 'People We Meet on Vacation' on January 9, 2026. Tom Blyth and Emily Bader headline the film adaptation of Emily Henry's bestselling novel.

general news.headline: No blame game, Tamil Nadu has failed to act: Government sources on cough syrup rowGovernment sources said the Coldrif syrup deaths issue is "not a blame game" but questioned Tamil Nadu Food and Drug Administration (TN-FDA) inaction. Tamil Nadu halted production, issued showcause notices, and initiated steps for criminal action against Sresan Pharmaceuticals.

Another boardroom battle at Tata Group?The current crisis arises from a power tussle within Tata Trusts, the philanthropic arm that holds a controlling stake in Tata Sons, the holding company that runs the operations of the Tata Group.

Mumbai gets its second wind as PM inaugurates Navi Mumbai airportPM Modi inaugurated Phase 1 of the Navi Mumbai International Airport on Wednesday. The new airport is expected to ease the heavy traffic burden on Mumbai's existing Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport.
Amit Shah goes desi with Zoho mail, reveals in Trump-styleAmit Shah is the latest minister to embrace Zoho-based platforms amid the government's 'swadeshi' push on the backdrop of US tariffs.

Chennai is missing two lions. BJP is desperately seducing one of themActor Vijay, who used to refer to himself as a lion, disappeared from public view even as the Karur stampede was unfolding. Forty-one fans, including children and women, died that deadly September night. Instead of calling out the lion king for abandoning his fans, the BJP is openly courting him. Should the party with a difference not show some deference to the people of Tamil Nadu?

Watch: Indian student fought for Russia to escape jail, surrendered in 3 daysA 22-year-old student from Gujarat, who went to Russia for higher studies, joined the Russian Army to avoid jail over drug charges. After just three days on the battlefield, he surrendered to Ukrainian forces, saying he'd rather stay imprisoned in Ukraine than return to Russia.

AUS vs PAK Live Score: Beth Mooney 109 takes Australia to 221 for 9AUS vs PAK Live Score, Women's World Cup: Beth Mooney scored 109 runs as Australia make a stupendous comeback to score 221 for nine. Alana King also supported her with a 48-ball 50. Nashra Sandhu was the pick of the Pakistani bowlers with three wickets.

Like a slum in UK: MP brands area with Indian, Pakistani residents, sparks rowBritish MP and shadow minister Robert Jenrick labelled Birmingham's multicultural Soho Road, home to Indian and Pakistani communities, a "slum" and "one of the worst integrated places" in the UK. His remarks triggered a backlash with locals, business leaders, and politicians fiercely defending the area.

How a blunder created a Vande Bharat recordSemi-high-speed Vande Bharat trains have a tall acclaim, but for once they fell short, not in stature but in height. The Sabarmati–Gurgaon Vande Bharat Special had to be sent on a longer route recently after the Indian Railways found that the train's pantograph couldn't reach the overhead wires. A record was created because of a blunder.

Yash Raj Films to shoot 3 major projects in UK from 2026: Keir StarmerPrime Minister Keir Starmer announced Yash Raj Films will shoot three major projects in the UK starting 2026. The move is set to create thousands of jobs and deepen UK-India creative industry ties.

How India is junking an age-old rule with Navi Mumbai, Jewar airportsThe inauguration of Navi Mumbai International Airport by PM Narendra Modi, along with the opening of the Noida International Airport later this month, heralds a new era for India's aviation. Indian cities, for the first time, are joining the big league of cities with multiple airports, like London and New York. This is why it's a game-changer.

Zubeen Garg's cop cousin arrested, was at Singapore yacht party where singer diedZubeen Garg's cousin Sandipan Garg, who is an Assam Police Services officer, has been arrested in connection with the singer's mysterious death.

Zoho has government backing. So what's the problem?Zoho is back in the spotlight after several ministers endorsed the desi tech company amid a 'swadeshi' push fuelled by rising US tariff tensions. However, fault-finding against Zoho has already begun. India need not look further than China and see how it built its own internet ecosystem.

Mounjaro becomes India's second-highest selling drug: What's driving its rise?Mounjaro clocked in Rs 80 crore in sales in September, becoming India's second-highest selling drug within six months of launch. Its rise highlights growing demand amid the country's obesity and diabetes challenges.

Chemistry Nobel awarded for breakthrough in molecular room designThese nanoscopic frameworks can trap, store, and manipulate gases and molecules, offering vast potential in tackling global sustainability challenges.

Who stopped you? PM shreds Congress over leniency on Pak after 26/11 attackCongress leader P Chidambaram recently claimed that the then UPA government decided not to retaliate against Pakistan after the dastardly terror attacks due to intense international pressure.

India was never united, except under Aurangzeb: Pak Minister's ludicrous claimPakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif admitted the possibility of another war with India, stressing that Islamabad must prepare for any eventuality.

Scotch prices to drop in India? UK-India trade deal to put whisky on the tableAs tariffs on Scotch whisky get slashed from 150% to 75% under the India-UK trade deal, iconic labels like Johnnie Walker and Glenfiddich might see a boom in India, the world's largest whisky market by volume. Reduced prices might see a surge in urban appetites across India and could unlock £1 billion in annual sales.

Russia warns of destroying Tomahawk missiles, launchers if US gives arms to UkraineTrump said on Monday he would want to know what Ukraine planned to do with Tomahawks before agreeing to provide them to Ukraine because he did not want to escalate the war.

Maharashtra merges boys' and girls' schools into co-ed across the stateThe Maharashtra government has decided to merge separate boys' and girls' schools operating in the same premises into co-educational institutions, following a Bombay High Court directive. The move aims to promote equality, reduce gender discrimination, and foster balanced participation in academics and school life.

8 Nobel Prize winners who skipped classes, failed subjects, yet changed the worldMany Nobel laureates defied conventional schooling, overcoming failures, expulsions, and doubts to achieve brilliance. From Einstein to Frances Arnold, unconventional paths often shaped the innovators who changed science forever.

Dhravya Shah leaves IIT prep to launch AI startup, raises $3 million19-year-old Mumbai-born Dhravya Shah has turned heads in Silicon Valley after his AI startup, Supermemory, secured $3 million in seed funding from Google executives.

6 dead, 8 injured in massive fire at firecracker factory in Andhra Pradesh's East GodavariA massive fire at a fireworks unit in Andhra Pradesh's East Godavari, killed six and injured eight. The blaze spread due to inflammable chemicals. Rescue and relief operations are underway under police and officials' supervision.

IndiGo fined Rs 20 lakh by aviation regulator for pilot simulator training lapseThe penalty, imposed on September 26, pertains to the use of non-qualified simulators for training pilots operating at high-risk airports such as Calicut, Leh, and Kathmandu.

sports.headline: Will India rest Mohammed Siraj in Delhi Test vs West Indies? India vs West Indies: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said India might rest Mohammed Siraj instead of Jasprit Bumrah for the second and final Test of the series, starting October 10 in New Delhi. Siraj has been picked in the ODI squad for a three-match series in Australia, starting October 19.

Determined Jemimah trains hard in rain-hit nets before South Africa clash Jemimah Rodrigues sweated it out hard for nearly an hour at the rain-delayed nets, while skipper Harmanpreet Kaur first went through catching drills before having a light 20-minute batting session on the eve of India's Women's World Cup clash against South Africa.

Jadeja is World No 1 all-rounder, far better than Stokes and Cummins: Parthiv Former India cricketer Parthiv Patel has declared Ravindra Jadeja as the best all-rounder in the world, ahead of Ben Stokes, Pat Cummins and Shakib al Hasan. Jadeja scored a magnificent 104* and picked up 4/54 in the first Test against West Indies to set up a comprehensive win by an innings and 140 runs.

Indian football aims for crucial win against Singapore in Asian Cup qualifier The Indian football team faces Singapore in a decisive AFC Asian Cup qualifier. The match outcome could significantly impact India's hopes of a third consecutive Asian Cup appearance.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma to reach New Delhi before flying to Australia: Report The Indian ODI squad will depart for Australia in two batches starting October 15. Shubman Gill takes over as captain, signalling a new leadership phase amid Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's continued presence.

Cummins, Head reject 10 million deal from IPL team to quit Australian cricket Pat Cummins and Travis Head have turned down lucrative offers worth $10 million per year from an IPL team group to quit international cricket and play in T20 leagues across the globe.

We were egotistical losers: Steven Gerrard on why England's golden era failed Steven Gerrard offers a candid assessment of England's 'golden generation,' addressing cultural issues, missed connections, and his ongoing aspirations in football management.

Returning after US Open, Aryna Sabalenka makes shaky start in Wuhan World No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka made a winning return at the 2025 Wuhan Open, defeating Rebecca Sramkova 4-6, 6-3, 6-1 to extend her unbeaten record at the tournament to 18-0.

It's a cancer in the system: Darren Sammy on causes of West Indies' prolonged decline IND vs WI: Darren Sammy believes that the West Indies' decline in cricket is a result of deep-rooted issues within their system

Temba Bavuma's warning: Inspired by New Zealand, South Africa hope to conquer India Temba Bavuma urged South Africa to take inspiration from New Zealand's successful India tour, citing their smart use of spin. The Proteas will tour India in November and December.

Once bitter rival, Ramos pens heartfelt letter on Alba's retirementJordi Alba is set to retire from professional football at the end of this season. His longtime rival, Sergio Ramos paid a touching tribute to the former Barcelona player.

Mohammed Siraj rises to career-best spot, Yashasvi Jaiswal slips out of top 5Mohammed Siraj achieved a career-best 12th rank in ICC Test bowling after a match-winning performance against West Indies in Ahmedabad. Jasprit Bumrah continues to lead the bowling charts while Ravindra Jadeja retains the No. 1 spot in the all-rounder rankings.

DRS: Will Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli play in 2027 ODI World Cup?With the tour of Australia in October-November, India officially begin the preparation for the 2027 ODI World Cup. Vizag rain dampens India's preparations for crucial South Africa clashWomen's World Cup 2025: The pitch and the outfield were covered hours before India's scheduled training session as heavy rain lashed Visakhapatnam on Wednesday. India will take on South Africa in their third game of the tournament on Thursday.

Special Abhishek Sharma wants to play Test cricket for India: Brian LaraAfter taking T20 cricket by storm, Abhishek Sharma is targetting Test cricket, revealed former SRH head coach Brian Lara. Speaking at the CEAT Awards, Lara spoke about what makes Abhishek special.

Rohit and Virat will be judged on ODI form, says ex-openerFormer India opener Aakash Chopra said Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will come under scrutiny for their performances, adding that consistency will be key to retaining their places in the ODI squad in the lead-up to the 2027 World Cup.

Hikaru throwing Gukesh's king was rehearsed: BTS video goes viralThe chess world was taken by storm after Hikaru Nakamura threw away D Gukesh's king after checkmating him. A BTS video now shows that the move was probably rehearsed.

Varun Chakravarthy addresses ODI selection snub: I expect to be in every teamDespite his standout performances in the Champions Trophy and Asia Cup, Varun Chakravarthy was not included in India's ODI squad for the Australia tour. The spinner discussed his omission and conversations with head coach Gautam Gambhir.

Pat Cummins could miss entire Ashes Test series due to injury: ReportPat Cummins is set to miss the start of the Ashes and could be sidelined for the full series against England due to a back injury, with Steve Smith likely to step in as captain.

Fitman: Rohit Sharma stuns fans with sleek look at award show ahead of ODI comebackRohit Sharma wowed fans with his slim and fit look at the CEAT Cricket Rating Awards in Mumbai, having reportedly shed 10 kg while training with former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar ahead of his ODI comeback in Australia.

Manchester United will win Premier League: Michael Owen's hope coded with warningMichael Owen told India Today that Manchester United's struggles go beyond Ruben Amorim. Structural flaws, inconsistency, and lack of cohesion persist, but with patience the Red Devils will return to glory.

Dravid's philosophies helped India win Champions Trophy 2025: Rohit SharmaIndia captain Rohit Sharma credited former coach Rahul Dravid's vision for their 2025 Champions Trophy success. Sharma said that the processes set by Dravid helped the team even after the coach left.

IND vs WI: Batting pitch likely in Delhi after woeful Windies show in AhmedabadThe second Test match in Delhi is likely to have a batting-friendly pitch that slowly turns into a spinning track. This comes in stark difference to the track that was dished out in the 2023 Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

India's Asia Cup celebration without trophy was Arshdeep's idea: VarunIndia mimicked their celebrations at the Asia Cup after being denied the trophy or the medals. Varun Chakravarthy reveals that the mock celebrations were the idea of Arshdeep Singh.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
